intro: Cynomarathrum, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. They are typically found in temperate regions and prefer well-drained soils. Cynomarathrum species often have lance-shaped leaves and can be either annual or perennial depending on the species. The genus is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and landscapes.
